name: expedia_bulk_search
description: Search multiple destinations on Expedia in parallel using concurrent browser tabs. Use this instead of calling expedia_search_hotels multiple times - it is faster and more efficient. Pass all destinations as a single comma-separated string.

detailSteps.code: const results = []; const items = document.querySelectorAll('[data-stid="property-listing"], [class*="hotel-card"], [class*="PropertyCard"]'); for (let i = 0; i < Math.min(items.length, 5); i++) { const el = items[i]; const nameEl = el.querySelector('h3, h2, [data-stid="content-hotel-title"]'); const priceEl = el.querySelector('[data-stid="content-hotel-price"], [class*="price"] span'); const ratingEl = el.querySelector('[class*="guest-rating"], [class*="review-score"]'); const linkEl = el.querySelector('a[href*="Hotel"], a[href*="hotel"]'); results.push({ name: nameEl ? nameEl.textContent.trim() : '', price: priceEl ? priceEl.textContent.trim() : '', rating: ratingEl ? ratingEl.textContent.trim() : '', url: linkEl ? linkEl.href : '' }); } const params = new URLSearchParams(window.location.search); return { destination: params.get('destination') || '', result_count: results.length, results: results }
detailSteps.name: search_results
detailSteps.label: Extract results
